info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 12:56AM PDT until August 21 at 7:00AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Lincoln County in south central Nevada... Southern Nye County in south central Nevada... Northwestern Clark County in southern Nevada... * Until 700 AM PDT Monday. * At 1256 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated persistent moderate rain falling across southern Nye County and western Clark counties. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain since 10 PM PDT. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of washes, low-water crossings poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pahrump, Mercury, Beatty, Spring Mountains, Lathrop Wells, Amargosa Valley, Indian Springs. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
